You just gave a great point to think about, Glen!
A framework may give you =
support for just one constrain in REST, but lacks support for all the other=
 ones. You may still be able to achieve a truly RESTful system with this, b=
ut you may also end up with an RPC based thing. The question is if we can b=
lame the framework? Should we also take into account the restrictions the f=
ramework can add to avoid this situation?

Interesting!

William.
